qas.question: When did Margaret Thatcher leave office?
What is another name for the Community Charge?
How did The Sun feel about the Poll tax?

answers.text: was vociferously supported by the newspaper

context: The Sun remained loyal to Thatcher right up to her resignation in <a0_0>November 1990<a0_0/>, despite the party's fall in popularity over the previous year following the introduction of the <a1_0>Poll tax<a1_0/> (officially known as the Community Charge). This change to the way local government is funded <a4_0>was vociferously supported by the newspaper<a4_0/>, despite widespread opposition, (some from <a3_0>Conservative MPs<a3_0/>), which is seen as having contributed to Thatcher's own downfall. The tax was quickly repealed by her successor <a2_0>John Major<a2_0/>, whom The Sun initially supported enthusiastically, believing he was a radical Thatcherite – despite the economy having entered recession at this time.
